Case reference: 2014003927.CaseDesc: On April 8, 1983, Blake Moorehouse was last seen between 2:00 pm and 6:00 pm in Richmond, British Columbia. There is reason to believe that Mr. Moorehouse and his companion Harold Brentzen left for the day to go freshwater fishing. The boat that Mr. Moorehouse and Mr.Brentzen were on board was recovered approximately 1.2 km north of the Roberts Creek Terminal. Mr. Brentzen's body was recovered near the boat, but Mr. Moorehouse was not located.

Case reference: 2014006384.CaseDesc: On January 7, 2014, at approximately 12:20 a.m., Yinghui Zhu was seen for the last time at her family’s restaurant in Toronto, Ontario. Yinghui was supposed to open the restaurant the next day but did not show up.

Coat: Black, Winter, Winter jacket; Brand: Lacoste

Case reference: 2014002435.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1978, Mary Click was seen for the last time as she left her home in Madison, Wisconsin. Mary had crossed the American and Canadian border at Pigeon River and intending to hitch hike to Banff, Alberta. Some of her personal belongings were discovered in Thunder Bay, Ontario on July 1, 1978 and Raith, Ontario on August 1, 1978.

Boots: Brown, HIKING, Possibly wearing hiking boots

Case reference: 2021000929.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2020, Ronald O'Kell was reported missing to the New York State Police in Niagara Falls, New York. Ronald’s unoccupied vehicle was recovered from a parking lot on Goat Island, New York. It is suspected that he may have jumped into the falls.

Case reference: 2008021099.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1966, Diane Prevost was seen for the last time as she was camping at Grundy Provincial Park in Britt, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Diane had been playing on the beach, and had told her father that she wanted to go back to the campsite. When her father turned to do so, she was gone.

Shirt: Blue, Red, checked top with red at cuffs and collar

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2020006296.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1964, Carol Turner was last seen with two boys from the Black Diamond Riders Motorcycle Club in Toronto, Ontario. Earlier that evening, Carol had argued with her mother, and left the house after her mother had gone to sleep.

Case reference: 2014003402.CaseDesc: Joan Currie was last seen around February 20, 1981. It is believed that she was traveling to Prince Edward Island to visit her parents. She suffers from alcoholism.

Case reference: 2014004990.CaseDesc: On January 6, 1978, at approximately 11:00 p.m., John McNichol was seen for the last time as he left the Crock & Block restaurant located in downtown Kitchener, Ontario. John had met with a friend that evening, and the two had planned to see each other again the next day. The following morning, he failed to show up for work and a note was found stating that he had to leave.

Luggage: SUITCASE, Suitcase, contained Leonard Cohen records
Shirt: Orange, « Grandma Lee » checkered, short sleeve

Case reference: 2012020038.CaseDesc: Desiree Oldwoman was last seen near her home on the Siksika Fist Nations Reserve near Gleichen, Alberta. She is autistic and does not speak, although she can write her name. Ms. Oldwoman was last seen on August 27, 2011.

Case reference: 2020007935.CaseDesc: On December 2, 1981, at approximately 4:30 pm, Everett Comer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Everett was scheduled to work, but did not show for his shift.

Suit: Blue, Uniform, "Extendicare" uniform with the word "Lyle" on the front pocket

Case reference: 2012020085.CaseDesc: Benjamin Entz was born, raised and lived on the Waldeck Hutterite Colony near Waldeck, Saskatchewan up until the time of his disappearance. His friends and family describe him as a very withdrawn individual. He left the colony the evening of September 18, 2011 on a tractor that was recovered the following day. The investigation/search for Benjamin has included numerous witness interviews, air and ground searches, and media releases, however he has yet to be located.

Case reference: 2016045557.CaseDesc: In January 2015, Warner Huckerby was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019072428.CaseDesc: In April of 2019, Corey Baldwin was seen for the last time in Ottawa, Ontario. It is out of character for Corey not to contact his father for an extended period of time. It is possible that Corey may be in British Columbia or Montreal, Quebec.

Scar: Chest, 2-3 Inches, a horizontal deep scar on the sternum
Lower Back, Surgical scar, horseshoe shape on the tailbone
Tattoo: Middle Back, Dragon on entire back
Left Arm, Sleeve with a graffiti wreath
Right Arm, Cartoon wolf with a police hat
Right Arm, A full sleeve to the elbow
Left Upper Arm, Inside left bicep written "I love her"

Case reference: 2013000074.CaseDesc: Pasquale Giannetti has been missing from Montreal since November 26, 1984. His vehicle was located at L'Ile Ste-Hélène and his clothes were found on the Jacques Cartier Bridge.

Case reference: 2014002117.CaseDesc: On January 13, 1996, Michelle Harmer was reported missing by an acquaintance of the family who last spoke with her on October 31, 1995. The last contact Michelle's family had with her was in early November 1995.

Case reference: 2006005299.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1970, Joseph Valem and two friends went fishing in a 16 foot fibreglass boat. Their boat sank on Georgian Bay, near Giants Tomb Island.  Mr. Valem is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2020006473.CaseDesc: On April 22, 1967, at approximately 6:00pm, Roy Debone was last seen by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002590.CaseDesc: On April 15, 2000, Merlin Labrie was seen for the last time as he left a gathering with friends in Levis, Quebec. Merlin was supposed to meet up with a friend, but he never did and has not been seen since.

Mark: Head, Multiple beauty marks on the face

Case reference: 2017017369.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1986, the mutilated body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 20-25 was found on the railway line near Highway 20 in Dorval, Quebec. The man was reportedly seen lying on the railroad tracks.

Case reference: 2006027099.CaseDesc: Mr. Deorksen and two acquaintances were travelling on Kioshkokwi lake, Pentland Township, Kiosk, Ontario, in a canoe when it capsized. The two acquaintances were located deceased, but Mr. Deorksen has never been found and is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014002241.CaseDesc: In April of 1972, Velma Marie Duncan was last seen by her brother hitchhiking from the Gang Ranch area to Williams Lake, BC. Ms. Duncan arrived at her sister’s residence and attended the downtown core of Williams Lake with her sister on May 3rd or 4th, 1972. Ms. Duncan entered a local bar, which was the last time she was seen.

Case reference: 2006007299.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1985, Byron Simmons and Julie Ann Schneider were observed fishing from a boat in Lake Huron. They were near the Nuclear Power Generation Station, near Inverhuron, Ontario, in the outflow from the nuclear plant. The couple failed to return to their cottage and are presumed drowned.  Their boat was recovered the following spring washed up on shore to the north, near Oliphant, Ontario.

Hair: Grey, White, Other, Short, Afro style

Case reference: 2008015999.CaseDesc: John Zuern was 21 years old when he went missing from the London Psychiatric Hospital in London, Ontario on June 14, 1975.  He did not return to his family home in Guelph, Ontario, and was reported missing by his family. He had been diagnosed as schizophrenic, and he walks with a pronounced limp.  Mr. Zuern's brother reported seeing him in the Bloor & Spadina area of Toronto during the summer of 1980.  He was believed to have been living on the streets at that time.

Hair: Grey, Long, Unkempt; unkempt Beard, Moustache
Deformity: leg, walks with a pronounced limp

Case reference: 2014002175.CaseDesc: On October 29, 1983, Dale Dushinski was seen for the last time. During the time of his disappearance, Dale was canoeing on the Athabasca River. His canoe was later found overturned approximately 10 kms north of Fort McMuray, Alberta.

Scar: A scar from a biopsy, unsure which knee

Case reference: 2014002329.CaseDesc: Blair Henry Yensen left his residence in the town of Capreol on January 7th, 1992. He was last seen walking on Ski Hill Road. He has a noticeable limp, walks with a cane and has a shoe insert in his left shoe. He smokes very heavily. He suffers from severe depression, seems to be quite religious, and speaks in a religious manner.

Jacket: Fishing Jacket, blue with yellow and gold lettering on the front and back.

Case reference: 2007002299.CaseDesc: Michelle Bigras last spoke to her mother on October 11, 1985. At the time she was planning to hitchhike to Warkworth Institution, located near Warkworth, Ontario, to visit her boyfriend. She never arrived.

Scar: Eyes, 2 small scars on left eyebrow

Case reference: 2014002991.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1988, Roberta Ferguson and eight other youths went to Sunnyside Campground at Cultus Lake in Chilliwack, BC. On August 24, 1988, Ms. Ferguson left the group on foot, it is believed she intended to return to her home in Surrey, British Columbia. Witnesses reported having seen a female walking on Columbia Valley Road, and others reported having seen a female getting into a vehicle at the intersection of Vedder Road and Cultus Lake Road. Ms. Ferguson has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002572.CaseDesc: André Demange was last seen on September 2, 1983, in Montreal, Quebec. André's personal effects were found a few days later near the water close to Des Ormeaux and Bellerive street.

Case reference: 2012020049.CaseDesc: William Krowchuk was last seen leaving his residence in Saskatoon, SK, around 10:00 p.m. on July 9, 1998. The vehicle he was driving at the time of his disappearance was located on July 14, 1998, in the downtown area of Saskatoon.

Deformity: Left Large Toe, No toe nail
Right Large Toe, No toe nail

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2012020074.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1988, Cathy Williams left her residence in St. Andrews, Manitoba to go to Winnipeg to fill out a job application. She had made arrangements to meet a male acquaintance who was going to help her complete the application. During the late afternoon and early evening, Cathy and her friend attended two bars and eventually ended up at a restaurant. Cathy left her friend at the restaurant to go to the residence of another male acquaintance who had invited her for a visit. She indicated that she had to get her purse from her friends car and she was going to be back in half an hour. Cathy was reported missing by her mother on the morning of August 23, 1988. Cathy has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018062782.CaseDesc: On April 12, 1993, at approximately 4:30pm, Helen Bialowas was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002936.CaseDesc: On February 3, 1988, David Ambroise, then 3 years old, was playing near the Saint-Maurice River in the First Nations reserve of Wemotaci. David approached too close to the water, slipped and fell in. He was then swept away by the current, and has never been found despite searches.

Case reference: 2014004654.CaseDesc: Richard Brokke was last seen at approximately 8:10 a.m. on July 15, 2005 leaving the 7-11 Store on St. Mary's Road in Winnipeg. His vehicle was located on July 19, 2005 near St. Jean Baptiste, Manitoba. Mr. Brokke's whereabouts remain unknown.

Shirt: Denim, White, Green, Golf shirt with green stripes on front

Case reference: 2012020123.CaseDesc: Paul Côté left his residence on June 13th 2000 and hasn’t been seen since. His car was located a few days later, on June 18th 2000, in a commercial parking lot in the city of Rimouski.

Case reference: 2014003678.CaseDesc: Donald McKillop’s spouse reported him missing on June 21, 1960. When she returned home on June 20 after working away from the house, she discovered he had left. When she last spoke to him on June 19, Donald had made no mention of intending to leave their house for any reason.  He didn't take his wallet or any other personal items when he left. Donald walks with a limp and there is no indication that foul play is suspected in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2015019929.CaseDesc: On April 16, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Sribavan Kandasamy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000050.CaseDesc: William 'Billy' Weinbender has been missing since approximately 7:30pm on May 6th, 1994 from Winnipeg. At the time he went missing he was living in an apartment building in the North End of the city. William "Billy" was last seen in the McPhillips Street and Leila Avenue area of Winnipeg.

Case reference: 2021038782.CaseDesc: On June 17, 2017, at approximately 7:50 p.m., John Shankland was last seen near the Brink of the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, John was despondent.

Shirt: Yellow, TEE SHIRT, T-shirt; “volunteer for MS, New York Chapter 2010”
Scar: Right Forearm, Three-inch scar from cancer surgery

Case reference: 2013000101.CaseDesc: Oswald Bear left his parents home in Peguis First Nation, Manitoba to go to the bush a short distance east of the house and cut some wood. Mr. Bear was very familiar with the area and enjoyed chopping wood. He spent a lot of time there and knew it well. He had never been lost in the bush and had never failed to return home previously. He visited at his sister's residence nearby at 6:15 p.m. Shortly thereafter, his sister told him that he should go home so that their mother wouldn't worry. When Mr. Bear left his sisters's residence, his intention was to go home, but he has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2018062795.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1993, at approximately 12:00pm, Mario Lencina was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Mario was on his way to Spain and his belongings were located at the airport, but he did not board the plane.

Sweater: Wool, Dark Blue, Red collar turtle neck
Scar: Left Side Of Head, 10 inch scar from temple to under the chin

Case reference: 2016059837.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2001, a male was found in the Detroit River, near 4200 block on Sandwich Street. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 138 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water a few days to a few months.

Hair: Short curly black hair on the left side of face
Teeth: Full gold crown on the lower left second molar
Jewelry: Braided, unknown if anklet or bracelet
Gold, Ears, Clear stone stud earrings
Ring: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Right Little Finger, 2 rings
Shirt: Black, Hooded sweatshirt with "Providence Friars" written on the front
Shorts: Blue, Gold, "Champion" brand short with the "University of Michigan" logo

Case reference: 2008018199.CaseDesc: Carl Braum and Thomas Lumsden were last seen on the morning of May 19, 1974, in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe, travelling in a northerly direction in the area of Depot Harbor. It was believed that they were travelling to the Killbear Park area. There were no lifejackets in the canoe.

Case reference: 2014005629.CaseDesc: On June 23, 2011, Yoo Heo was seen for the last time at a Youth Centre in Toronto, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Yoo had recently arrived to Canada from Korea.

Case reference: 2014005573.CaseDesc: In November/December 1976, Vernon Loiselle was visiting family in an Edmonton, Alberta hospital. Vernon left the hospital and hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006008599.CaseDesc: Adrien McNaughton wandered off into a wooded area of Holmes Lake, Brougham Township, on June 12, 1972.

Scar: Forehead, approximately 1 - 2 inches long, and possibly over the left eye.

Case reference: 2014003988.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1989, Gordon Clark was last seen at his residence in Richmond, British Columbia.  He had an argument with his common law wife who left the residence and when she returned home, he was gone.  Gordon has not been heard from or seen by any family members or friends since.

Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2019052051.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2019, at approximately 4:00 am, Brandon Pollock was seen for the last time at his family residence in Hamilton, Ontario. That same morning, three men on a boat observed a man swimming in the area of the Lift Bridge in Lake Ontario. The men approached the swimmer, who was later identified as Brandon Pollock, to confirm his wellbeing. Brandon had told them that he was okay and advised them to pass by.

Mark: Right Side Of Neck, A brown birthmark on the right side of the neck, below the ear

Case reference: 2014001337.CaseDesc: On March 17, 1983, Micheline Chailler was seen for the last time at her apartment in Lévis, Quebec. Micheline last contacted a member of her family by telephone on March 19, 1983. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, Beige, Brown with beige stripes

Case reference: 2013000082.CaseDesc: On April 26, 2011, Michel Petit was reported missing from his residence located in the De Lorimier district of Montreal, Quebec. All his personal belongings were found in his apartment and his vehicle was parked in front of his home.

Case reference: 2014001287.CaseDesc: Lawrence Wellington Allard was last seen in December 1975 in Kamloops, British Columbia.  Lawrence has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002286.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1980, Guy Fortier was seen for the last time as he left his residence, without saying where he was going, in Montreal, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, Guy was despondent and suffering from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2018063232.CaseDesc: On December 31, 1999, Elizabeth Shelly was last seen as she left the shelter she was staying at in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002919.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1988, Andrée Thibault was seen for the last time the Sainte-Marie District in Montreal, Quebec. Andrée may have been seen in Western Canada in the Vancouver, British-Columbia area.

Case reference: 2014002300.CaseDesc: Steven Thomas MacLaren was reported missing when he failed to show up at work on July  11, 1981.  When last spoken to, he had planned on going hiking in Kananaskis Provincial Park. It is believed he was last seen on June 29, 1981.

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2014003733.CaseDesc: Gaétan Anglehart was last seen in a brewery with friends on June 2, 1975, in Montreal, Quebec. That night, Gaétan was seen being forced into a Cadillac vehicle.

Tattoo: Right Hand, Star on thumb and index finger
Left Shoulder, Dagger and inverted snake head and a name (unknown)

Case reference: 2014004812.CaseDesc: Grant MOFFAT attended the Fas Gas outlet at the junction of HWY 5 and PTH 68. Here he purchased a fishing license. MOFFAT was at this location for about 20 minutes and did not seem to be in a hurry. On August 20, 2006 the vehicle belonging to MOFFAT was located on HWY 481 about 3 km west of Crane River. The vehicle had not been reported stolen. The whereabouts of MOFFAT remain unknown.

Case reference: 2009003999.CaseDesc: At about 1 p.m. Robert Aho of North Bay left Land O’Lakes Cottages located in Martin River and headed west bound on Highway 64 towards Field. He was carrying a packsack and duffle bag and has not been in contact with his family since.

Shirt: Blue, White, Long sleeved, Toronto Maple Leaf

Case reference: 2014004211.CaseDesc: On August 24, 1987, Louis Haineault, 48 years old, was last seen heading out in a boat to fish on Cree Lake, north of Buffalo Narrows, SK. Searchers located his boat and fishing nets, however the boat was inoperable. Searches of the area failed to locate Louis.

Case reference: 2006026799.CaseDesc: On Friday, May 19, 1967, at about 06:10 A.M,. Victor Morris left his cottage on the South Shore of Lake Nipissing in an 18 foot Geisler Cedar Strip boat with an 18 hp motor. On Sunday, May 21 1967, the boat was recovered on Manitou Island in Lake Nipissing. The boat was partially burnt and the motor showed signs of having exploded.

Case reference: 2014003349.CaseDesc: On March 14, 1993, Carl Berg Ellingsen was seen for the last time with his family at his residence in the East Vancouver region of British Columbia. Carl has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002743.CaseDesc: On January 16, 1994, Yoann Crouzatier was reported missing after leaving the family residence in Laval, Quebec. Yoann has not been seen or heard from since.

Boots: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Metal tips
Coat: Beige, Three-quarters with fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2008015499.CaseDesc: Sheryl Sheppard was last seen on January 2 1998, on Lundy's Lane in Niagara Falls, Ontario. An extensive investigation by the Hamilton Police Service was conducted but Sheryl Sheppard has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005970.CaseDesc: Gary Forster was last seen on January 13, 2013, in Lachute, Québec. His car was found in Montréal, Québec.

Case reference: 2018005122.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2018, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Balwant Singh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Balwant was visiting Canada and failed to board his returning flight on January 29 at 6:00 p.m.

Case reference: 2014019687.CaseDesc: On November 23, 2013, an unidentified partial male skull was found in a forested area along a power line in Anmore near Coquitlam, BC. The decedent has likely been missing for several years.

Deformity: Head, Fractured facial bones. Underwent surgery to his skull, possibly during the 1980s or 1990s

Case reference: 2008005899.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1965, George Angeconeb left Red Lake on foot with plans to walk to Trout Lake.  He left during a severe snowstorm carrying a record player.  He was last seen at MacDowell Lake, First Nation Territory, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002896.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1981, at around 10:00pm, Madeleine Thibault was seen for the last time on Commercial Road in Lévis, Québec. While leaving her house, Madeleine mentioned that she was going to her mother's for a visit.

Jewelry: Gold, COLLIER, Chain with two hearts
Mark: Mouth, Beauty mark on the left side

Case reference: 2014003446.CaseDesc: Dawn Crey was a resident of the downtown east side of Vancouver; she was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. She was reported missing on December 11, 2000 after failing to attend a medical appointment. Foul play is suspected in Ms. Crey's disappearance.

Case reference: 2023053891.CaseDesc: On June 17th, 2023, Elora Patoine was last seen when she was dropped off in Borden, Prince Edward Island.  She was then driven to Moncton, New Brunswick, where she remained until June 19th.  Elora has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Leather, Brown, Faux leather brown coat

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005327.CaseDesc: Edward Tandrup was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta in February of 1983. Edward Tandrup may have been hitchiking to Vancouver, BC at the time.

Case reference: 2020011793.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1985, Ruth Koenig was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ruth had taken some time off from working following the death of her husband on October 18, but never returned.

Case reference: 2014006557.CaseDesc: Alvin Berg, 35 years old, was originally from the Pierceland District, SK. He was working as a farm labourer in the Spinney Hill district near Maymont, SK. Mr. Berg was last seen when he left this farm in October of 1940, after which he had no further contact with his family.

Case reference: 2018046253.CaseDesc: On January 31, 1997, at approximately 4:30pm, Daphne Powell was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. Daphne left her residence with two suitcases, some money and indicated that she was going to Jamaica.

Case reference: 2016064705.CaseDesc: On May 14, 1995, a partial skull was found on the bank of the North Saskatchewan River, north of Derwent, Alberta. The individual had likely been deceased for more than 5 years

Case reference: 2014045101.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an older adult female were found near Chasm, British Colombia in 2010. She had no teeth in her lower jaw and had likely gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2014006024.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2013, Richard Bailey was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was reported missing by his wife the next day when he failed to return home from work.

Case reference: 2019000913.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2019, Daniel Hill was seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014003345.CaseDesc: Tom Dobrowolsky was last seen leaving his Richmond, British Columbia, residence on February 21, 1981. Tom was originally from Montreal, Quebec, and had previously lived in various provinces across Canada.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Both upper eye teeth are missing
Mark: Mouth, Both upper eye teeth are missing
Scar: Left Leg, Varicose vein scars on both legs

Case reference: 2012020014.CaseDesc: Sharon Gayle Dawson was seen for the last time on Christmas day in 2010, when she left her home in Qualicum Beach on Vancouver Island, British Columbia. There is an unconfirmed report that she was seen on December 28, 2010 at the World Parrot Refuge near Coombs, B.C.

Case reference: 2012020137.CaseDesc: On Friday September 27, 1963, Diane Carrier went to the neighborhood park in the Old Quebec district of Quebec City, Quebec, to advise her brother to return home for dinner. Her brother came home alone and Diane has never been seen since.

Case reference: 2006010399.CaseDesc: William Halverson was last seen getting into a canoe at Bald Indian Bay in Lake of the Woods. He failed to arrive at his destination of Pine Portage Bay.

Case reference: 2017048277.CaseDesc: On August 20, 2017 at 11:00 pm, Christina Cooper was last seen leaving her boyfriend's residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020124.CaseDesc: On October 5, 1995, Ronald Couture was seen for the last time at approximately 7:30 a.m. when he left his home in Terrebonne, Quebec. Ronald told his wife he was heading to the south shore area of the city to look for a job. The vehicle he was driving, a white 1993 Pontiac Grand-Am bearing Quebec licence plate WGT 621, was never located. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014002649.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1978, Garry Allen and a friend were fishing on Turtle Lake near Glaslyn, SK. Witnesses state the weather changed and the water got very rough. On October 20th, they were reported missing. A swamped canoe and the body of the friend was located, however, searches failed to locate Garry.

Case reference: 2014003643.CaseDesc: Dean Mortensen was reported missing on January 24, 1992, after he failed to attend his classes at the University of Alberta in Edmonton, Alberta. Dean was last seen by his friends leaving the on campus bar, The Ship. They parted ways with him within 200 metres of his dorm room at the St. Joseph's College that night.

Jacket: Grande Cache Bantam Elks leather hockey jacket with gold shoulders, white collar, "Dean" on sleeve
Shirt: ST JOSEPH, St. Joseph crest on front

Case reference: 2014005703.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1964, Harold Jackman was seen for the last time at his farm in Shillington, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Harold wandered away from his farm.

Case reference: 2012003199.CaseDesc: In 1982, Lance Kunderman, age 22, left his home in Waterloo Region and headed to Banff, Alberta. Lance was reportedly in British Columbia in October 1982 and was to travel abroad. He was working with singer Eric Clapton's road crew. On December 26, 1982 Lance spoke with his family saying he was still with the band. Information was that Lance worked between Los Angeles and Vancouver. He was last seen in Vancouver, British Columbia in October 1982.

Scar: Genitals, may have a surgical scar from a twisted testicle operation

Case reference: 2014003512.CaseDesc: In early October 1992, Darlene Shallow was seen for the last time between Danforth Street and Midland Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006000199.CaseDesc: October 26, 1986, an unidentified man was found under the ramp to the Gardiner Expressway and Spadina Avenue behind 252 Queens Quay West, in Toronto, Ontario. He was well-nourished, and was found not wearing any clothing.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Male pattern baldness, 4mm facial stubble
Mark: Left Elbow, Small mole on the side of his left elbow

Case reference: 2014005543.CaseDesc: In December 2010, Yellowknife RCMP received a call from a concerned family member reporting that they have not seen or heard from Kelvin Smallgeese since September 2010. At the time of his disappearance, Kelvin was believed to be residing in Yellowknife, Northwest Territories.

Teeth: Dental records indicate 6 teeth missing, 11 treated (occlusal) 15 unknown
Tattoo: Left Hand, A rose and a heart

Case reference: 2014003432.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1979, June Johnson was driven by a friend to the Marlboro Hotel in Prince Albert.  June has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001898.CaseDesc: According to her husband, Isabell Brooks left her home near Highway 7 and Tenth Concession (now Reesor Road) in Markham, Ontario on foot on March 4, 1972. Isabell said she'd return in a week, but she was never seen again.

Mark: Head, Mole on top of head

Case reference: 2016070415.CaseDesc: On December 2, 2016, Houda Doumi left Canada with her two children, Zineb and Rayan Lahrim and connected at the John F. Kennedy Airport in New York City, USA, where they then travelled on to Cairo, Egypt. It is believed that Houda and the children are actually in the United Arab Emirates.

Case reference: 2016026140.CaseDesc: Amber Wilson was last seen at 9:30pm on May 15, 2016, in Edmonton's downtown area. Amber has medical issues, and she is dependent on her medication. Amber lives a high risk lifestyle, and it is out of character for her not to be in contact with her family. Her family is extremely concerned for her welfare.
